p: Finally, in order to deliver health services continuously throughout climate-related events, governments must craft effective emergency management plans and adopt effective practices, including clearly communicating health risks to members of the public as events unfold. Provision of robust communications equipment and redundant medical supplies should be part of any plan. Plans should be developed at the national and facility levels, and should be based on input from appropriate stakeholders, as well as incorporate up-to-date assessments of risk. The effectiveness of emergency management personnel in communicating health risks is likely to vary based on education levels within communities, which also vary by SSP. Greater efforts and simpler messaging strategies, co-produced with communities of interest, will likely be needed in areas with lower levels of education, so that instructions from health professionals are more likely to be followed [ 49].
